intro: Nauclea synkorynes, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elliptical leaflets and produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Nauclea synkorynes is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
